definition: to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
to monopolize/to seize/to take into one's arms/to embrace/to fasten (with a rope etc)/to take on (responsibility etc)/to canvass

sentences.english: Talent introduction departments also actively went out visiting science and technology management talent.
sentences.chinese: 人才引進部門還積極走出去延攬科技管理人才。

sentences.english: Has the expected goal of recruitment been achieved?
sentences.chinese: 是否達到延攬預期目標？

sentences.english: Scientists and technicians were engaged and organised on a very large scale .
sentences.chinese: 在極爲龐大的規模上延攬和組織科學家和技術人員。

definition: lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4

definition: trader or dealer (of stocks and shares etc)
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
Four Asian Tigers/East Asian Tigers/Four Little Dragons (East Asian economic powers: Taiwan, South Korea, Singapore and Hong Kong)
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
